segments.pli: Atha kho aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho sā devatā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then, late at night, a glorious deity, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, went up to the Buddha, bowed, stood to one side, and said to him:
“Sir, these six things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant.

segments.pli: Satthugāravatā, dhammagāravatā, saṃghagāravatā, sikkhāgāravatā, appamādagāravatā, paṭisanthāragāravatā—
segments.en: Respect for the Teacher, for the teaching, for the Saṅgha, for the training, for diligence, and for hospitality.

segments.pli: ime kho, bhante, cha dhammā bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattantī”ti.
segments.en: These six things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant.”

segments.pli: Atha kho sā devatā “samanuñño me satthā”ti bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā tatthevantaradhāyi.
segments.en: Then that deity, knowing that the teacher approved, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before vanishing right there.

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā tassā rattiyā accayena bhikkhū āmantesi:
segments.en: Then, when the night had passed, the Buddha told the mendicants all that had happened, adding:

segments.pli: “imaṃ, bhikkhave, rattiṃ aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yenāhaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā maṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho, bhikkhave, sā devatā maṃ etadavoca:
Satthugāravatā, dhammagāravatā, saṅghagāravatā, sikkhāgāravatā, appamādagāravatā, paṭisanthāragāravatā—
ime kho, bhante, cha dhammā bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattantī’ti.
Idaṃ vatvā maṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā tatthevantaradhāyīti.

segments.en: “Respect for the Teacher and the teaching,
and keen respect for the Saṅgha;
and has drawn near to extinguishment.”

sections.title: Then, late at night, a glorious deity, lighting up…

suttaplex.blurb: A god speaks on things leading to decline or non-decline.
